group_1.narration: Hanna is really smart.@One after one, she figured out things@I hadn't even noticed.
She was the one who realized that the@magic that makes people obey me...@no, my suggestion magic,@could also be used on myself.
Thanks to her,@I could take the kind, affectionate parents@and the fun school life that had only@existed in my imagination...
and use suggestion magic@to make myself believe that@they were real and right here.

group_1.textCenter: Oh... I get it...@That's right, it was all just suggestion.

group_1.narration: Well, it's true that when I got home@reality would hit me like a brick.@My suggestions faded away and@I felt horrible, but...
I could simply cast my magic again and be happy.@I was satisfied with just that.
That day, I cast a suggestion on myself@and went out like usual, but...

group_1.textLeft: Ah, I can't.@I have to go home soon.
Sorry, lately I've been out pretty late and my@parents have been making a fuss about it...
No, wait! They're not mad at me or anything!@It's just, my dad is kind of a worrywart.
He's concerned that I might be hanging@around bad company.
But I bet that if they got to know you@they wouldn't say that anymore.

group_1.textRight: Hmm... Okay, how about I go say@hello to them, then?
Well... There's still the whole Witch@business to think about...
I don't want you to lose your freedom.

group_1.textLeft: B-but it's my house we're talking about.@Would you really go through the trouble of visiting?

group_1.textRight: What are you so suspicious about?@You have a lot of friends, right?
Don't you invite them to your house all the time?

group_1.textLeft: Th-this is great! It'll be the first time@I'll bring a friend to my house!
Um, but today we're eating out,@so maybe next time?
You sure?@I won't let you consider reconsidering.
Just the thought of having my very best friend@in the world, Hanna, come over to my house

group_1.textRight: Geez, I get it already... Hey, you had to@get home early, right? Get going.

group_1.textLeft: Yeah, see you tomorrow!@Let's pick the date then!

group_1.textCenter: No, I can't possibly pick a date...

group_1.narration: It was only after arriving home and having@the suggestion break that I realized what a@ridiculous promise I had made.
If I admitted I lied,@Hanna might start hating me...@The thought made me feel@like my heart was breaking apart.
It was nevertheless proof of how important@Hanna had become to me.

group_1.textCenter: Still, I can't think of any way to fool her...

group_1.narration: That's right, I have those two.
If I take Hanna to the house of those people@I enchanted into believing I'm their daughter,@I would be able to trick her.
It's my only option left.@I can't have her find out I'm a liar.
